TOOL_SYNC_INSTRUMENT_NAVIGATOR: Use selected instrument when adding notes
FIELD_ACTOR_INVOKE: Executes the scripts attached to Actor
FIELD_SPRITE_SHEET_ACTOR_DESC: The sprite to use for rendering the actor.
FIELD_SPRITE_SHEET_PLAYER_DESC: The sprite to use for rendering the player.
FIELD_SPRITE_SHEET_PROJECTILE_DESC: The sprite to use for rendering the projectile.
FIELD_SPEED_FADE_DESC: The speed of the fade animation.
FIELD_SPEED_PLUS_INSTANT_DESC: The movement speed, use 'Instant' to immediately move to the new location.
FIELD_SCENE_POP_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Pop the top scene state from stack.
FIELD_SCENE_POP_ALL_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Pop all scene state from stack.
FIELD_SCENE_RESET_STATE_DESCRIPTION: Clears the stack of saved scene states.
FIELD_SLIDE_UNTIL_COLLISION_DESC: Set to make the actor continue to move until a collision with another actor or the scene occurs.
FIELD_SET_TRUE_IF_DESC: The menu item text label which when selected will set variable to 'true'.
FIELD_SET_FALSE_IF_DESC: The menu item text label which when selected will set variable to 'false'.
FIELD_MIN_VALUE_RAND_DESC: The minimum value for the random range.
FIELD_MAX_VALUE_RAND_DESC: The maximum value for the random range.
FIELD_STOP_MUSIC: Stops any music that was previously playing.
FIELD_SAVE_DATA: Save current game data to memory. Requires cartridge type with BATTERY.
FIELD_CLEAR_DATA: Clear all saved game data from memory.
FIELD_IF_SAVED_DATA: Run if player has saved a game.
TEXT_SPEED_IN_DESC: The speed that the text and menu dialogue boxes scroll on to the screen.
TEXT_SPEED_OUT_DESC: The speed that the text and menu dialogue boxes scroll off of the screen.
TEXT_SPEED_DESC: The speed that characters are drawn into the dialogue boxes.
FIELD_ON_PRESS_DESC: The script to run when the button is pressed.
FIELD_MATH_NOTE: Note: Variables have max values of 255 and will wrap if increased above 255 or below 0.
FIELD_MATH_NOTE_NO_CLAMP: Note: Without clamping enabled value will wrap if increased above 255 or below 0.
FIELD_GBC_FAST_CPU: Use Double Speed Mode (Improves CPU Performance)
FIELD_FREQUENCY_DESC: The frequency of the sound effect in hz (Tone effect only).
FIELD_DURATION_SHAKE_DESC: The length of time to shake camera for in seconds or frames.
FIELD_DURATION_WAIT_DESC: The length of time to pause the script for in seconds or frames.
FIELD_DURATION_SOUND_DESC: The length of time to play the sound effect.
FIELD_PITCH_DESC: The pitch of the sound effect (Beep effect only).
FIELD_TEXT_AVATAR_DESC: The avatar image to optionally display on the left hand side of the dialogue box.
FIELD_SET_TO_VALUE_IF_MENU_DESC: The menu item text label which when selected will set variable to '{value}'.
FIELD_LAST_OPTION_CANCELS_DESC: Set if last menu item should cause variable to become '0' when selected.
FIELD_CANCEL_IF_B_DESC: Set if pressing 'B' should cause menu to close and variable to become '0'.
FIELD_LAYOUT_MENU_DESC: Set the layout style of the menu.
FIELD_CUSTOM_EVENT_DESCRIPTION_PLACEHOLD: Describe the purpose of this script
FIELD_WAIT_UNTIL_FINISHED_SOUND_DESC: Set if script should pause until sound effect has finished playing.
FIELD_USE_COLLISIONS_DESC: Set if collisions with both scene and actors should be taken into account while moving.
FIELD_COLLISION_GROUP_DESC: The collision group that should be used when registering collisions with actors.
FIELD_COLLIDE_WITH_DESC: The groups of actors that will be checked for collisions. e.g. If it should pass through any actors but the player set this field to just 'Player'.
FIELD_REPLACE_SCENE_TYPE_DEFAULT_DESC: Causes this sprite to override the default for all scenes of the current type. i.e. If you are currently in a platformer scene, all other platformer scenes using the default sprite will now load using this replacement sprite automatically instead.
FIELD_PERSIST_BETWEEN_SCENES_WARNING: Note: Some events like projectiles and sprite sheet changes currently don't work when used in an input script that is persisted between scenes.
FIELD_ALLOW_FASTFORWARD: Fast forward text while buttons held
FIELD_ALLOW_FASTFORWARD_DESC: Allow skipping through animation of text if joypad buttons are pressed.
FIELD_IF_COLOR_SUPPORTED: Run if the game is executing in a device that has color support.
FIELD_ON_TIMER_TICK_DESC: The script to run when the timer is triggered.
FIELD_NUM_FRAMES_LABEL: Number of frames used by actors in scene
FIELD_NUM_SPRITE_TILES_LABEL: Number of tiles used by sprites in scene
FIELD_ACTORS_COUNT: This scene has used {actorCount} of {maxActors} available
FIELD_FRAMES_COUNT: This scene has used {frameCount} of {maxFrames} available
FIELD_SPRITE_TILES_COUNT: This scene has used {tileCount} of {maxTiles} available
FIELD_TRIGGERS_COUNT: This scene has used {triggerCount} of {maxTriggers} available
FIELD_TMP_DIRECTORY_INFO:
The location where temporary files are stored during the build of your game.
If you are unable to build your game due to permissions errors you can change this to a folder that you have access to.
FIELD_8BIT_DESCRIPTION: 8-bit number with a maximum value of 255.
FIELD_16BIT_DESCRIPTION: 16-bit number with a maximum value of 65535.
FIELD_16BIT_CALCULATION: Value is calculated using two 8-bit variables
FIELD_VARIABLE_NOT_USED: Variable hasn't been used in project
FIELD_CHOOSE_REPLACEMENT_DETAILS: Choose a replacement tile in the 'Tiles' panel.
FIELD_ON_SAVE_DESC: A script to run after the save is completed. This won't be run on game load so you can use it show a 'Save Was Successful' message.
FIELD_ON_LOAD_DESC: A script to run after this save data has been loaded.
FIELD_UI_PALETTE_NOTE: Note: GB Color background palette #8 is also used for UI elements like dialogue windows and menus.
FIELD_EMOTE_PALETTE_NOTE: Note: GB Color sprite palette #8 is also used for emotes.
FIELD_SGB_PALETTE_NOTE: Note: Super GB default palette is shared with GB Color palette #5, changing either will also update the other value.
FIELD_CART_BATTERYLESS: Save game data to ROM (Supported Flash Carts Only)
FIELD_CART_BATTERYLESS_MORE_INFO_1: This feature causes game data to be saved into a ROM bank and is only compatible with specific (often bootleg) flash cartridges.
FIELD_CART_BATTERYLESS_MORE_INFO_2: If you are unsure, you likely want this setting disabled.
FIELD_CART_BATTERYLESS_MORE_INFO_3: ROMs built for web or preview will ignore this setting to ensure compatibility with the inbuilt emulator.
FIELD_ANIMATION_STATE_DESC: The sprite animation state to use.
FIELD_SPRITE_TILES_TOOLTIP:
The number of tiles used in this frame.

A maximum of 40 sprite tiles can be displayed on screen at once, and a maximum of 10 tiles can be displayed on the same horizontal row.
FIELD_SPRITE_UNIQUE_TILES_TOOLTIP:
This number of unique tiles used by this sprite in total across all animations.

Reduce the number of unique tiles to allow more sprites to be used in a single scene.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_LIFE_TIME_DESC: The amount of time in seconds that the projectile will live for.
FIELD_LOCK_AXIS_DESC: Set if either horizontal axis, vertical axis or both should be locked.
FIELD_OVERRIDE_DEFAULT_BUTTON_ACTION_DES: Set if the script should replace the default game action for the specified button.
FIELD_AUTOMATIC_FADE_IN_DISABLED: Automatic Fade In is disabled for this scene
FIELD_AUTOMATIC_FADE_IN_DISABLED_INFO: You must add a "{eventName}" event manually.
FIELD_RNG_SEED_DESCRIPTION: Place this to run in response to user input to ensure random numbers change between playthroughs
FIELD_REFERENCES_DESC: A list of the assets and entities used in your GBVM script. Use this to let GB Studio know that a file is needed by your script, preventing it from being excluded in the final build.
FIELD_SOUND_EFFECT_PLAY_DESC: The sound effect to play. Can choose from files within `/assets/sounds` or from preset sounds like `Beep`, `Pitch` and `Tone`.
FIELD_EFFECT_INDEX_DESC: The effect number to play (for fxhammer only).
FIELD_PRIORITY_SOUND_DESC: The priority of the effect, high, medium or low. If two sound effects are playing at the same time then higher priority sound effects will take precedence.
FIELD_FROM_FOR_DESC: The initial value of the counter variable.
FIELD_TO_FOR_DESC: The end value of the counter variable.
FIELD_PASS_BY_VALUE_DESCRIPTION: This variable is being passed by value, any changes to the variable within the script will not affect the variable outside of the script
FIELD_PASS_BY_REFERENCE_DESCRIPTION: This variable is being passed by reference, any changes to the variable within the script will also change the variable from outside of the script
FIELD_COMPARISON_DESC: The comparison operator to use e.g. 'Less Than' or 'Greater Than'.
FIELD_COMPARISON_RELATIVE_DESC: The relative position comparison to use e.g. 'Is Above' or 'Is Below'.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_DESTROY_ON_HIT_DESC: Set if the projectile should be destroyed after its first collision.
FIELD_OPERATION_FOR_DESC: The operation to use for combining a value with the counter variable after each loop.
FIELD_OPERATION_MATH_FUNC_DESC: The operation to use for modifying the variable value.
FIELD_ON_CALL_ROUTINE_DESC: The script to run when the routine is called.
FIELD_TIMER_DESC: The timer that should be modified, each scene can use up to four timers at once.
FIELD_HUGE_DRIVER_NOTE: Supports playing, creating and editing music in .uge format.
FIELD_MOVE_TYPE_DESC: Choose if should move in horizontal/vertical axis first or if it should move diagonally to destination.
FIELD_MOVE_TYPE_SHAKE_DESC: Choose if camera should shake only in horizontal or vertical axis or if should shake in both directions.
FIELD_ACTOR_ACTIVATE_DESC: The actor you want to activate.
FIELD_ACTOR_DEACTIVATE_DESC: The actor you want to deactivate.
FIELD_ACTOR_HIDE_DESC: The actor you want to hide.
FIELD_ACTOR_SHOW_DESC: The actor you want to show.
FIELD_ACTOR_MOVE_CANCEL_DESC: The actor you want to cancel movement for.
FIELD_ACTOR_MOVE_DESC: The actor you want to move.
FIELD_ACTOR_CHECK_DESC: The actor you want to check.
FIELD_ACTOR_UPDATE_DESC: The actor you want to update.
FIELD_ACTOR_DISTANCE_DESC: The actor to compare distance with.
FIELD_ACTOR_RELATIVE_DESC: The actor to compare position with.
FIELD_ACTOR_EMOTE_DESC: The actor to display an emote image above.
FIELD_X_SCENE_DESC: The initial player horizontal position in the new scene.
FIELD_Y_SCENE_DESC: The initial player vertical position in the new scene.
FIELD_X_RELATIVE_DESC: The horizontal offset relative to the current position.
FIELD_Y_RELATIVE_DESC: The vertical offset relative to the current position.
FIELD_X_VARIABLE_DESC: The variable to use for the horizontal position.
FIELD_Y_VARIABLE_DESC: The variable to use for the vertical position.
FIELD_DIRECTION_VARIABLE_DESC: The variable to use for the direction.
FIELD_VARIABLE_READ_DESC: The variable to read the value of.
FIELD_TRUE_DESC: The script to run if the condition is true.
FIELD_FALSE_DESC: The script to run if the condition is false.
FIELD_ACTOR_PROJECTILE_SOURCE_DESC: The actor to launch the projectile from.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_OFFSET_X_DESC: The horizontal offset from the source actors position to start launching the projectile.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_OFFSET_Y_DESC: The vertical offset from the source actors position to start launching the projectile.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_OFFSET_DESC: The distance the projectile should move from launch position in its launch direction before becoming visible.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_DIRECTION_DESC: The direction to launch the projectile. Can either be a fixed direction or based on an actor's current direction.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_ANGLE_DESC: The angle to launch the projectile.
FIELD_PROJECTILE_TARGET_DESC: The actor to launch the projectile towards
FIELD_BOUNCE_HEIGHT_DESC: How high the player should bounce.
FIELD_VALUE_FOR_DESC: The value to combine with the counter variable after each loop.
FIELD_VALUE_MATH_FUNC_DESC: The value to combine with the variable using the selected operation.
FIELD_BUTTON_REMOVE_DESC: The joypad button to remove the attached script from.
FIELD_TIME_INTERVAL_TIMER_DESC: The length of time to wait before running the script each time.
FIELD_ENGINE_FIELD_READ_DESC: The engine field to read the value of.
FIELD_FILL_COLOR_OVERLAY_DESC: The color to fill the overlay with, either black or white.
FIELD_SCRIPT_DESC: A valid GBVM Script to execute.
FIELD_MAGNITUDE_DESC: The amount of camera movement during a camera shake.
FIELD_START_BY_ADDING_SCENE: Start by clicking here to add your first scene.
FIELD_VALUE_SWITCH_DESC: The value to compare the variable with for running this branch of the script.
FIELD_VALUE_SET_DESC: The value to set the selected variable to.
FIELD_PAUSE_TO_VIEW_SCRIPTS: Pause debugger to view currently running scripts
FIELD_COLOR_MODE_MONO_NOTE: Allows your game to run on all devices using four colors only.
FIELD_COLOR_MODE_MIXED_NOTE: Allows your game to run on monochrome and color devices.
FIELD_COLOR_MODE_COLOR_NOTE: Allows your game to run on color devices only.
FIELD_COLOR_MODE_COLOR_LIMITATIONS_NOTE: Increases the amount of tiles available in each scene for displaying backgrounds and sprites.
FIELD_SGB_UNAVAILABLE: Super GB Mode is not supported for 'Color Only' games
FIELD_TILESET_DESC: The tileset to fetch tiles from
FIELD_FROM_TILE_DESC: The starting tile offset inside tileset
FIELD_TO_TILE_DESC: The ending tile offset inside tileset
FIELD_STATE_VARIABLE_DESC: A variable to store the current state of this event
FIELD_ANIMATION_FRAMES_DESC: The number of animation frames to cycle through.
FIELD_COMMON_TILESET_DESC: Setting a common tileset for a scene will cause the selected tileset tiles to always be loaded in the same order. Careful use of this on two scenes will allow you to seamlessly switch between the scenes with no transition and no tile glitching.
FIELD_MONO_OVERRIDE_DESC: This image is using automatic palettes with a monochrome override defined at "{tilesFilename}" which will determine the tile data used, while "{filename}" will determine the colors
FIELD_SCRIPT_NOT_USED: Script hasn't been used in project
FIELD_COMPILER_OPTIONS_WARNING: Some combinations of Compiler Preset and Optimisation settings may not work together. If you are unable to build after changing these settings, try resetting them back to their default values.
FIELD_PREFAB_NOT_USED: Prefab hasn't been used in project
FIELD_UNPACK_PREFAB_DESC: All properties and scripts from the prefab will no longer be linked
FIELD_RUN_A_BUILD_USAGE_DESC: Run a build to calculate ROM usage
FIELD_CURRENT_ROM_SIZE_TOOLTIP: Your ROM needs to grow {freeSpace} to fill this size.
FIELD_NEXT_ROM_SIZE_TOOLTIP: Your ROM needs to grow {freeSpace} to get to this size.
FIELD_DIALOGUE_CLOSE_NONMODAL_LABEL: Only required if you have opened a dialogue box with no close condition
FIELD_OVERLAY_SET_SCANLINE_CUTOFF_LABEL: Overlays and Dialogue windows will only be drawn if above this line
FIELD_OVERLAY_SCANLINE_CUTOFF_Y_DESC: The vertical scanline where the overlay window will stop being drawn.
FIELD_DIALOGUE_POSITION_DESC: The position to place the dialogue window
FIELD_DIALOGUE_MIN_HEIGHT_DESC: The minimum height to draw the dialogue window.
FIELD_DIALOGUE_MAX_HEIGHT_DESC: The maxiumum height to draw the dialogue window.
FIELD_TEXT_X_DESC: The horizontal offset to start drawing text in the dialogue window.
FIELD_TEXT_Y_DESC: The vertical offset to start drawing text in the dialogue window.
FIELD_TEXT_SCROLL_HEIGHT_DESC: The number of lines of text that can be displayed before scrolling.
FIELD_CLEAR_PREVIOUS_DESC: Clears any content that was previously drawn on the overlay.
FIELD_SHOW_FRAME_DESC: Draw a frame around the border of the dialogue window.
FIELD_CLOSE_WHEN_DESC: The condition which will cause the dialogue window to close.
FIELD_NONMODAL_POSITION_TOP_WARNING: To close a non-modal dialog positioned at the top of the screen, you can use a "Close Non-Modal Dialogue" event or you will need to manually reset the overlay scanline cutoff with a "Set Overlay Scanline Cutoff" event.
FIELD_CLOSE_DELAY_DESC: Delay closing for a period of time.
FIELD_TEXT_DRAW_LOCATION_DESC: The location where text should be drawn.
FIELD_ACTIVE_CHANNELS_DESC: The channels that will produce sound. Any unselected channels will be muted.
FIELD_SET_FRAME_IMAGE_DESC: The tileset to use as a dialogue frame.
FIELD_SET_FRAME_IMAGE_INFO: Must be a tileset of size 24px x 24px
FIELD_PRINT_SOURCE_DESC: The location of the image data to print.
FIELD_PRINT_HEIGHT_DESC: The number of lines to print.
FIELD_PRINT_MARGIN_DESC: The number of empty lines to leave after printing.
FIELD_SUCCESS_DESC: The script to run on success.
FIELD_ERROR_DESC: The script to run on error.
FIELD_DURATION_ACTOR_EFFECT_DESC: The length of time to play the actor effect.
FIELD_SET_THREAD_HANDLE_VARIABLE_DESC: As the thread starts a handle will be stored in this variable. You can use this handle to stop the thread later.
FIELD_READ_THREAD_HANDLE_VARIABLE_DESC: The handle for the thread you want to stop.
FIELD_RUN_IN_BACKGROUND_DESC: The script to run in the background thread.
EVENT_SWITCH_SCENE_DESC: Transition to a new scene with player at a specified position and direction. A connection line will be drawn between the source of the event and the destination scene with an icon appearing at the destination position. It's possible to drag this icon around and between scenes to modify the event.
EVENT_WAIT_DESC: Pause the script for a period of time.
EVENT_CAMERA_SHAKE_DESC: Shake the camera for a period of time.
EVENT_IF_TRUE_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the specified variable is set to true.
EVENT_IF_FALSE_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the specified variable is set to false.
EVENT_IF_VALUE_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script based on the value of a variable compared with a value.
EVENT_IF_VALUE_COMPARE_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script based on the value of a variable compared with another variable.
EVENT_IF_INPUT_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the specified joypad button is currently pressed. Will not wait for user input and will only execute once, if you wish to run a script every time a button is pressed use Attach Script To Button instead.
EVENT_IF_ACTOR_AT_POSITION_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if an actor is at a specified position.
EVENT_IF_ACTOR_DIRECTION_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if an actor is facing in a specified direction.
EVENT_SET_TRUE_DESC: Set the value of the specified variable to true.
EVENT_SET_FALSE_DESC: Set the value of the specified variable to false.
EVENT_SET_VALUE_DESC: Set the specified variable to a defined value.
EVENT_INC_VALUE_DESC: Increase the value of the specified variable by one.
EVENT_DEC_VALUE_DESC: Decrease the value of the specified variable by one.
EVENT_SCENE_PUSH_STATE_DESC: Store the current scene and player state on to the scene stack, this allows you to return to this exact location later using the Scene Restore events. A common use of this event would be to include in a script just before a Change Scene event to open a menu scene, in the menu scene you could wait for the player to press a close button and then use the Restore Previous From Stack event to return to where the player opened the menu.
EVENT_SCENE_POP_STATE_DESC: Transition to the last stored scene from the scene stack using the specified fade speed. The previous scene will then be removed from the stack so the next time this event is used it will transition to the scene before that.
EVENT_SCENE_POP_ALL_STATE_DESC: Transition to the very first scene stored on the stack, for instance if you had multiple levels of menu scenes you could use this to imediately return to the game scene. This event will cause the scene stack to become empty.
EVENT_SCENE_RESET_STATE_DESC: Remove all scenes from the scene stack without leaving the current scene.
EVENT_CHOICE_DESC: Present two options to player allowing them to make a choice, will set the specified variable to true if the first option is chosen and to false if the second option is chosen.
EVENT_RESET_VARIABLES_DESC: Reset all variables used by your project back to false.
EVENT_LOOP_DESC: Run part of the script in a loop forever. Remember to break out of the loop otherwise the player will become stuck at this point. You can use a Stop Script or Change Scene event to stop the loop.
EVENT_LOOP_FOR_DESC: Run part of the script in a loop while a counter variable is within a specified range. On each loop the counter variable is modified before the next check.
EVENT_LOOP_WHILE_DESC: Run part of the script in a loop while an expression is true.
EVENT_GROUP_DESC: Alows you to group together parts of your script for organizational purposes.
EVENT_COMMENT_DESC: Allows you to leave notes within your scripts. Provides no functionality in-game. The text you type automatically gets set in the event title, so you can collapse the comment and still read its content.
EVENT_TEXT_DESC: Show a dialogue box at the bottom of the game screen. When text is shown the dialogue box will slide up from the bottom of the screen and will slide down after it has been shown.
EVENT_CAMERA_MOVE_TO_DESC: Move the camera to a new position.
EVENT_CAMERA_SET_POSITION_DESC: Set the position of the camera, causing it to instantly move to the new location.
EVENT_CAMERA_LOCK_DESC: Move the camera back to centering on the player, locking into position when the player moves. Optionally allows locking to follow player in only horizontal or vertical axis.
EVENT_FADE_IN_DESC: Fade the scene from a blank screen.
EVENT_FADE_OUT_DESC: Fade the scene to a blank screen.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_DIRECTION_DESC: Change the direction that an actor is currently facing.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_POSITION_DESC: Set the position of an actor, causing it to instantly move to the new location.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_POSITION_RELATIVE_DESC: Set the position of an actor relative to it's previous position, causing it to instantly move to the new location.
EVENT_ACTOR_GET_POSITION_DESC: Store the current position of an actor within two variables, one to store the horizontal position and another to store the vertical position.
EVENT_ACTOR_GET_DIRECTION_DESC: Store the current direction of an actor within a variable.
EVENT_ACTOR_MOVE_TO_DESC: Move an actor to a new position.
EVENT_ACTOR_MOVE_RELATIVE_DESC: Move an actor relative to its current position.
EVENT_ACTOR_MOVE_CANCEL_DESC: Cancel any currently running "Actor Move" events affecting this actor. Causes the actor to stop in its current location.
EVENT_ACTOR_PUSH_DESC: Causes the specified actor to be moved in the direction that the player is currently facing. Useful for creating block puzzles.
EVENT_ACTOR_EMOTE_DESC: Show an emote image above a specified actor. The image will be positioned centrally above the actor's collision bounding box.
EVENT_ACTOR_HIDE_DESC: Hide an actor, causing it to become invisible. Its OnUpdate script will continue to run while hidden.
EVENT_PLAYER_SET_SPRITE_DESC: Set the sprite that should be used to render the player.
EVENT_SHOW_SPRITES_DESC: Re-enable rendering of the sprite layer if previously disabled.
EVENT_HIDE_SPRITES_DESC: Disable rendering of sprite layer causing all sprites to become hidden until sprite rendering is reenabled.
EVENT_OVERLAY_SHOW_DESC: Show either a black or white window over the top of the current game screen. Can be used to obscure and then reveal parts of the scene background for example on the sample project logo screen.
EVENT_OVERLAY_MOVE_TO_DESC: Moves the overlay to a new position on the screen.
EVENT_AWAIT_INPUT_DESC: Pauses the script until one of the specified joypad buttons are pressed.
EVENT_MUSIC_PLAY_DESC: Plays a music file. If you play a new song while another song is playing, the old song will stop automatically.
EVENT_STOP_DESC: Stops the current script from running.
EVENT_LOAD_DATA_DESC: Load the saved game data from the selected slot.
EVENT_SAVE_DATA_DESC: Save the current game data into the selected slot.
EVENT_CLEAR_DATA_DESC: Remove any previously saved game data in the selected slot.
EVENT_IF_SAVED_DATA_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if save data is present within the specified save slot.
EVENT_PEEK_DATA: Store Variable from Game Data In Variable
EVENT_PEEK_DATA_DESC: Read a variable's value from a specified save slot and store it in a variable.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_MOVEMENT_SPEED_DESC: Set the movement speed of an actor to a new value.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_ANIMATION_SPEED_DESC: Set the animation speed of an actor to a new value.
EVENT_TEXT_SET_ANIMATION_SPEED_DESC: Set the speed that dialogue boxes appear and disappear and how fast text appears within the box.
EVENT_SET_INPUT_SCRIPT_DESC: Run the specified script any time a joypad button is pressed.
EVENT_REMOVE_INPUT_SCRIPT_DESC: Remove an attached script from a joypad button restoring the default functionality of the button.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_FRAME_DESC: Set an actor's animation to a specified frame value.
EVENT_VARIABLE_MATH_DESC: Allows you to perform various maths functions on a variable to add/subtract/multiply/divide/modulus a value/variable/random number.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_FRAME_TO_VALUE: Set Actor Animation Frame Using Variable
EVENT_SWITCH_DESC: Conditionally run from multiple options depending on the value of the specified variable. First choose how many options you want to compare the variable against, then set the values to compare and what scripts to execute when the value is matched.
EVENT_SET_FLAGS_DESC: Set the value of a variable by enabling individual bits of the 16-bit number. Allows 16 true/false values to be stored within a single variable. Setting the flags will replace the previous value of the variable.
EVENT_ADD_FLAGS_DESC: Set selected flags to true on a variable. All unselected flags will keep their previous value.
EVENT_CLEAR_FLAGS_DESC: Set selected flags to false on a variable. All unselected flags will keep their previous value.
EVENT_IF_FLAGS_COMPARE_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the specified variable has the chosen flag set as true.
EVENT_SOUND_PLAY_EFFECT_DESC: Play a sound effect, choose from playing a .WAV, .VGM, or .SAV (fxhammer) file from `/assets/sounds` or a preset sound effect.
EVENT_SET_TIMER_SCRIPT_DESC: Run the specified script repeatedly after a time interval. The script will keep running in the background until a Remove Timer Script event is called or the scene is changed using a Change Scene event.
EVENT_TIMER_RESTART_DESC: Reset the countdown timer back to zero. The script will call again after the time specified originally.
EVENT_TIMER_DISABLE_DESC: Remove the timer script so it will no longer be called.
EVENT_MENU_DESC: Display a menu of multiple options and set the specified variable to the value of the chosen option. Multiple layouts are provided, 'Menu' displays as a single column on the right hand side of the game screen and 'Dialogue' displays a full width dialogue box with two columns. You can optionally set the 'B' button to close the menu setting the variable to '0' and can also make the last menu item return '0' when selected.
EVENT_ACTOR_COLLISIONS_ENABLE_DESC: Re-enable collisions for an actor causing it to become solid again if collisions had previously been disabled.
EVENT_ACTOR_COLLISIONS_DISABLE_DESC: Disable all collision checks for an actor allowing the player and all other actor's to pass through it while moving.
EVENT_LAUNCH_PROJECTILE_DESC: Launch a projectile from an actor in a specified direction. When a project collides with other actors it will trigger their OnHit scripts.
EVENT_IF_ACTOR_RELATIVE_TO_ACTOR_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script based on the position of one actor relative to another.
EVENT_IF_ACTOR_DISTANCE_FROM_ACTOR_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if an actor is within a certain distance of another actor.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_SPRITE_DESC: Set the sprite that should be used to render an actor.
EVENT_PLAYER_BOUNCE_DESC: In platform scenes causes the player to bounce upwards by setting the player's velocity Y value.
EVENT_PALETTE_SET_BACKGROUND_DESC: Replace some or all of the current scene's background palettes.
EVENT_PALETTE_SET_UI_DESC: Replace the palette used for the UI (background palette #8).
EVENT_ACTOR_STOP_UPDATE_DESC: Stop an actors OnUpdate script if it was currently running.
EVENT_ACTOR_START_UPDATE_DESC: Start an actors OnUpdate script if it is not currently running. If the actor is currently offscreen its script may become deactivated causing the script to stop running again, to prevent this set the 'Keep Running While Offscreen' setting for the actor's OnUpdate script.
EVENT_IF_COLOR_SUPPORTED_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the game is being played on a device or emulator that supports color games.
EVENT_IF_DEVICE_SGB: If Super GB Mode Is Available
EVENT_IF_DEVICE_SGB_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the game is being played on a device or emulator that supports Super GB games.
EVENT_IF_DEVICE_GBA_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the game is being played on a device or emulator that supports GBA games.
EVENT_ENGINE_FIELD_SET_DESC: Change the value of an Engine Field.
EVENT_ENGINE_FIELD_STORE_DESC: Store the value of an Engine Field in a variable.
EVENT_VARIABLE_MATH_EVALUATE_DESC: Set a variable to the result of evaluating a math expression.
EVENT_IF_EXPRESSION_DESC: Conditionally execute part of the script if the specified math expression evaluates to true.
EVENT_PALETTE_SET_SPRITE_DESC: Replace some or all of the current scene's sprite palettes.
EVENT_PALETTE_SET_EMOTE_DESC: Replace the palette used for emotes (sprite palette #8).
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_STATE_DESC: Change the sprite animation state for a specified actor.
EVENT_CALL_CUSTOM_EVENT_DESC: Call one of your custom scripts. Once you have chosen a script you will be able to hook up any parameters required.
EVENT_SET_MUSIC_ROUTINE_DESC: Attach a script to one of the four music routines that can be triggered from a .uge file. In the music editor you are able to use the call routine effect in your songs to trigger these scripts in time to music.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_MOVEMENT_SPEED_LABEL: {actor} Set Movement Speed To {speed} Pixels Per Frame
EVENT_RNG_SEED_DESC: Place this to run in response to user input to ensure random numbers change between playthroughs.
EVENT_ACTOR_ACTIVATE_DESC: Activate an actor, causing it to become visible (if not also hidden) and for its OnUpdate script to start.
EVENT_ACTOR_DEACTIVATE_DESC: Deactivate an actor, causing it to act as if it had gone offscreen. It will become invisible and its OnUpdate script will be stopped.
EVENT_IDLE_DESC: Pause the script for a single frame.
EVENT_REPLACE_TILE_XY_DESC: Replace a tile at a specified coordinate with another from a tileset.
EVENT_REPLACE_TILE_XY_SEQUENCE: Replace Tile At Position From Sequence
EVENT_REPLACE_TILE_XY_SEQUENCE_DESC: Replace a tile at a specified coordinate with another from a tileset in a sequence.
EVENT_IF_DESC: Conditionally run part of the script if the specified value evaluates to true.
EVENT_SCRIPT_LOCK_DESC: Pause other scripts and scene updates until this script has finished or is unlocked.
EVENT_SCRIPT_UNLOCK_DESC: If locked, unlock this script so other scripts can run and the scene can update.
EVENT_ACTOR_SET_COLLISION_BOX_DESC: Set the collision bounding box of an actor to a position and size.
EVENT_TEXT_SET_SOUND_EFFECT_DESC: Set a sound effect to play as each text character is displayed.
EVENT_DIALOGUE_CLOSE_NONMODAL_DESC: Close any dialogue box or overlay currently on screen and reset the overlay scanline cutoff value.
EVENT_OVERLAY_SET_SCANLINE_CUTOFF_DESC: Set a cutoff y position where the overlay window will stop being drawn. Allows drawing an overlay at the top of the screen.
EVENT_TEXT_DRAW_DESC: Write some text to a specified positon on either the scene's background or the overlay.
EVENT_MUTE_CHANNEL_DESC: Set which audio channels are active and which are muted.
EVENT_SET_DIALOGUE_FRAME_DESC: Set a tileset to replace the dialogue frame image.
EVENT_PRINT_DESC: Send an image to a GB Printer for printing. A GB Printer device must be connected.
EVENT_CAMERA_PROPERTY_SET_DESC: Update a property of the game camera.
EVENT_ACTOR_EFFECTS_DESC: Play an actor effect animation on a selected actor.
EVENT_THREAD_START_DESC: Run a script in another thread.
EVENT_THREAD_STOP_DESC: Stop a thread based on the selected thread handle.
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_SMALL: Background is too small, must be at least 160px x 144px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_LARGE: Background is too large, must be at most 256px x 256px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_NOT_MULTIPLE_OF_8: Background width or height is not a multiple of 8px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_WIDE: Background is too wide, was {width}px wide when maximum is {maxWidth}px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_TALL: Background is too tall, was {height}px tall when maximum is {maxHeight}px
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_MANY_PIXELS: Background contains too many pixels, {numPixels} ({width}px * {height}px) when maximum is {maxPixels}
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_MANY_TILES: Background contains too many unique 8x8px tiles ({tilesetLength} where limit is {maxTilesetLength}) meaning it may not display correctly. Consider reducing the amount of detail in this image.
WARNING_BACKGROUND_LOGO_REUSED: Background is already used in a Logo scene ("{name}") and it may not display correctly. Consider choosing a different background.
WARNING_MUSIC_TOO_LARGE: Music track {filename} is too large to fit in memory ({bytes} bytes when maximum is {maxBytes}). Consider reducing the number of patterns in the file.
WARNING_ENGINE_OUT_OF_DATE:
Ejected engine is out of date (found "{ejectedEngineVersion}" when latest is "{expectedEngineVersion}").
You may encounter issues if you don't eject your engine again.
WARNING_TOO_MANY_ONSCREEN_ACTORS: Too many actors may be onscreen at once around "{actorName}"
WARNING_ONSCREEN_ACTORS_LIMIT: Only {maxOnscreen} actors can be visible on screen at once
WARNING_FRAMES_LIMIT: This scene is over available limits and may have rendering issues. Try reducing number of actors in scene or use static and non animated sprites where possible. Stay within limits to prevent tile data overwriting sprite data
WARNING_SPRITE_TILES_LIMIT: This scene is over available limits and may have rendering issues. Try reducing number of actors in scene or simplify their sprites to use less unique tiles
WARNING_ACTORS_LIMIT: This scene contains too many actors, some actors will not be visible during gameplay
WARNING_TRIGGERS_LIMIT: This scene contains too many triggers, some triggers will not be included during gameplay
WARNING_NO_PLAYER_SET_FOR_SCENE_TYPE: No Default Player Sprite has been set for "{type}" scenes. Set one in the "Settings" section.
WARNING_TOO_MANY_UNIQUE_PROJECTILES: Too many unique projectiles used in scene "{name}". Scene contained {num} unique projectiles when max per scene is {max}.
WARNING_ENGINE_PLUGIN_OUT_OF_DATE: Plugin "{pluginName}" was created for an older version of GB Studio and may not work correctly. Plugin uses engine "{pluginEngineVersion}" but GB Studio is using engine "{expectedEngineVersion}".
WARNING_ENGINE_PLUGIN_MISSING_MANIFEST: Plugin "{pluginName}" is based on an unknown engine version and may not work correctly. Plugin authors can fix this issue by making sure `engine/engine.json` exists in the plugin containing at least `{"version": "{expectedEngineVersion}"}`.
WARNING_BACKGROUND_TOO_MANY_PALETTES: Background contains too many unique four color palettes ({paletteLength} where limit is {maxPaletteLength}) meaning it may not display correctly. Consider reducing the amount of colors used in this image.
WARNING_BACKGROUND_IS_NOT_A_VALID_PNG: Background "{filename}" is not a valid PNG file
ERROR_MOVED_OR_DELETED: It may have moved location or been deleted
ERROR_MISSING_FONTS: No fonts found in assets/fonts folder. An example font has been copied there for you to use.
ERROR_ASSET_DOESNT_BELONG_TO_CURRENT_PRO: This asset does not belong to the currently opened project
SPLASH_SAMPLE_PROJECT_DESCRIPTION: A GBC template containing examples of top down, platformer, point and click and shooter scenes
SPLASH_SAMPLE_PROJECT_ORIGINAL_DESCRIPTI: The original GB Studio template. A short 4 color top down game
SPLASH_NO_RECENT_PROJECTS: No projects have been opened recently.
DIALOG_SAVE_CHANGES: Do you want to save the changes you made to "{name}"?
DIALOG_SAVE_WARNING: Your changes will be lost if you don't save them.
DIALOG_UPDATE_DESCRIPTION: GB Studio {version} available. Would you like to update?
DIALOG_NEWEST_VERSION_AVAILABLE: GB Studio {version} is currently the newest version available.
DIALOG_UNABLE_TO_CHECK_LATEST_VERSION: Unable to check latest version at the moment
DIALOG_MIGRATION_DESCRIPTION:
Your project was created with version {currentVersion} and needs to be migrated to version {version}. This may prevent your project being opened in older versions of GB Studio.

It is recommended to back up your project before continuing.

Some manual changes to your project may be required, see migration guide for more details.
DIALOG_FUTURE_DESCRIPTION:
This project file was created with version {currentVersion} which is newer than this version of GB Studio supports. Maximum supported is {version}.

You may need to update GB Studio.
DIALOG_LANGUAGE_CHANGES_NEED_RESTART: GB Studio needs to restart before language changes can take effect
DIALOG_LANGUAGE_SAVE_AND_RESTART: Please save your project and restart the application.
DIALOG_DELETE_CUSTOM_EVENT_USED:
{count} uses of this script will also be removed.

Found in: {sceneNames}
DIALOG_DELETE_CUSTOM_EVENT_USED_SINGLAR:
{count} use of this script will also be removed.

Found in: {sceneNames}
DIALOG_EJECT_ENGINE_DESCRIPTION:
The latest GB Studio engine files will be copied to 'assets/engine'. You can make changes to any of these files and they will replace the default engine during builds.

To restore the default engine delete 'assets/engine'
DIALOG_EJECT_ENGINE_REPLACE_DESCRIPTION:
You have already ejected the GB Studio engine to your project.

If you continue the previously ejected files will be replaced and any changes you made will be lost.
DIALOG_ENABLE_COLOR_MODE_DESCRIPTION:
Your project currently has color mode disabled, would you like to enable it?

Color mode projects will work with both GB and GBC devices.

You can disable this later in 'Settings'.
DIALOG_REPLACE_CUSTOM_EVENT_DESCRIPTION: The pasted script contains a modified version of an existing script. Would you like to replace the script with the version on your clipboard or keep your existing script?
DIALOG_IMPORT_ASSET_DESCRIPTION: File asset type can not be automatically determined, where would you like to add this asset
DIALOG_TRACKER_CHANGES_NOT_SAVED: Do you want to save the changes you made to "{name}"?
DIALOG_TRACKER_CHANGES_NOT_SAVED_DESCRIP: Your changes to the current song will be lost if you don't save them.
DIALOG_DELETE_PREFAB_USED: {count} uses of this prefab will be unpacked
DIALOG_DELETE_PREFAB_USED_SINGLAR: {count} of this prefab will be unpacked
DIALOG_REPLACE_PREFAB_DESCRIPTION: The pasted prefab contains a modified version of an existing prefab. Would you like to replace the prefab with the version on your clipboard or keep your existing prefab?
DIALOG_DELETE_PRESET_DESCRIPTION: Any uses of this preset will become unlinked.
DIALOG_APPLY_PRESET_DESCRIPTION: Modifying this preset will cause all uses of the preset to also be updated.
ERROR_UNABLE_TO_SAVE_MUSIC_FILE_DESC: Double check the file you're trying to edit isn't Read-only
COMPILER_LOCAL_ENGINE_NOT_FOUND: Local engine not found, using default engine
MESSAGE_ADD_UGE_FILES: Please add .uge files to the project assets/music folder or create a new song with the + button above.
MESSAGE_USE_MOD_FILES: In order to use .mod files in your project you should change the current music format from UGE to MOD. You can change this at any time in 'Settings'.
MESSAGE_ADD_MOD_FILES: Please add .mod files to the project assets/music folder.
MESSAGE_USE_UGE_FILES: To use .uge files in your project, change the music format from MOD to UGE in 'Settings'. You can change this at any time in 'Settings'.
MESSAGE_NOT_PREVIEW_SUBPATTERN: Instrument and note preview might not be accurate when subpattern is enabled.
